Heading: No outer packaging
Note: No packaging, or all smaller items enclosed inside largest item

Heading: Slip-sleeve
Note: Thin card or soft plastic sleeve, much less rigid than a slip case

Heading: Clamshell
Note: Packaging consisting of formed plastic sealed around each side of the product. Not to be confused with single-sided Blister pack

Heading: Keep case
Note: Typical DVD-style packaging, sometimes known as an ‘Amaray’ case

Heading: Jewel case
Note: Typical CD-style packaging

Heading: Digipak
Note: Common CD-style packaging, a card folder with one or more panels incorporating a tray, hub or pocket to hold the disc(s)

Heading: In box
Note: Individual item, items or set in card box with separate or hinged lid: not to be confused with the commonly-used ‘boxed set’

Heading: Slip-cased
Note: Slip-case for single item only: German ‘Schuber’

Heading: Slip-cased set
Note: Slip-case for multi-volume set: German ‘Kassette’; also commonly referred to as ‘boxed set’

Heading: Tube
Note: Rolled in tube or cylinder: eg sheet map or poster

Heading: Binder
Note: Use for miscellaneous items such as slides, microfiche, when presented in a binder

Heading: In wallet or folder
Note: Use for miscellaneous items such as slides, microfiche, when presented in a wallet or folder

Heading: Long triangular package
Note: Long package with triangular cross-section used for rolled sheet maps, posters etc

Heading: Long square package
Note: Long package with square cross-section used for rolled sheet maps, posters, etc

Heading: Pouch
Note: In pouch, eg teaching materials in a plastic bag or pouch

Heading: Rigid plastic case
Note: In duroplastic or other rigid plastic case, eg for a class set

Heading: Cardboard case
Note: In cardboard case, eg for a class set

Heading: Shrink-wrapped
Note: Use for products or product bundles supplied for retail sale in shrink-wrapped packaging. For shrink-wrapped packs of multiple products for trade supply only, see code XL in List 7

Heading: Blister pack
Note: A pack comprising a pre-formed plastic blister and a printed card with a heat-seal coating

Heading: Carry case
Note: A case with carrying handle, typically for a set of educational books and/or learning materials

Heading: In tin
Note: Individual item, items or set in metal box or can with separate or hinged lid
